This is actually a lot easier in H3, because of the way the Spring-based 
configuration-bootstrapping works. You can just add your own instances 
of the right types to the configuration (crawler-beans.cxml), and during 
the 'build' stage they will be 'auto-wired' into the proper sets of 
event-listeners.

Anyone extending H3 code and adding their own classes to crawl 
configurations should become very familiar with this portion of the 
Spring documentation:

http://static.springsource.org/spring/docs/2.5.x/reference/beans.html

For an existing H3 class that receives notification of each URI's 
completion for its own recordkeeping purposes, see 
'org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlLimitEnforcer'.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA


On 10/27/10 8:19 AM, bsdang_2004 wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> We want to capture the events CrawlStateEvent and CrawlURIDispositionEvent and then log the crawledURI info in a database. I have written an EventHandler implemeting the ApplicationListener, which will be invoked on these events, however how and which stage can I hook my EventHandler to heritirix 3.0.0 ?
>
> In heritrix 1.x, we can write a custom Statistics Tracker and addListener(customEventHandler) to the CrawlController, however how can we hook it in heritrix 3.0.0 is not clearly documented.
>
> Any suggestions would be helpful.
>
